comments.body:
This code doesn't support windows directly, although the current implementation on Windows uses GLFW, which is the same as Linux.  Both of those are changing though.

The new key event design will address being able to fully synthesize key events so as to be indistinguishable from key events coming from the platform, and since it's no longer platform specific, will work for all platforms.

I realize the existing code did this too but it seems very strange to me for release logic to depend on the contents of a field called "debugName". I would naively expect that field to be meaningless outside of presentation to human readers. Should the field name be changed to make more clear that its contents are meaningful to release mode logic?

Yes, this code is not meant to be run in release mode.  It is strictly for testing.  Ideally there would be a better mapping from physical key to logical key equivalent, but that would require knowing what the keyboard mapping is, and we don't yet have that information.

Again, this entire synthesis mechanism is meant to be replaced by the new key event code.
